fields.name: shared_buffers
fields.description: Sets the amount of memory the database server uses for shared memory buffers.

fields.name: effective_io_concurrency
fields.description: Sets the number of concurrent disk I/O operations that PostgreSQL expects can be executed simultaneously.

fields.name: commit_delay
fields.description: commit_delay adds a time delay, measured in microseconds, before a WAL flush is initiated. This can improve group commit throughput by allowing a larger number of transactions to commit via a single WAL flush.

fields.name: commit_siblings
fields.description: Minimum number of concurrent open transactions to require before performing the commit_delay delay.

fields.name: checkpoint_segments
fields.description: Maximum number of log file segments between automatic WAL checkpoints (each segment is normally 16 megabytes).

fields.name: checkpoint_timeout
fields.description: Maximum time between automatic WAL checkpoints, in seconds

fields.name: default_statistics_target
fields.description: Sets the default statistics target for table columns without a column-specific target set via ALTER TABLE SET STATISTICS. Larger values increase the time needed to do ANALYZE, but might improve the quality of the planner's estimates.

fields.name: wal_buffers
fields.description: The amount of shared memory used for WAL data that has not yet been written to disk. The default setting of -1 selects a size equal to 1/32nd (about 3%) of shared_buffers, but not less than 64kB nor more than the size of one WAL segment, typically 16MB.

fields.name: effective_cache_size
fields.description: Sets the planner's assumption about the effective size of the disk cache that is available to a single query.

fields.name: bgwriter_lru_maxpages
fields.description: In each round, no more than this many buffers will be written by the background writer. Setting this to zero disables background writing.
